column1: Respiratory alkalosis is a condition marked by low levels of carbon dioxide in the blood due to breathing excessively.

Common causes include: - Anxiety - Fever - Hyperventilation - Pregnancy (this is normal) Any lung disease that leads to shortness of breath can also cause respiratory alkalosis (such as pulmonary embolism and asthma).
The symptoms may include: - Dizziness - Light-headedness - Numbness of the hands and feet
Your doctor or nurse will perform a physical exam.
Breathing into a paper bag -- or using a mask that causes you to re-breathe carbon dioxide -- sometimes helps reduce symptoms.
